Package sample.Controller

Class StoreOrdersController

java.lang.Object
sample.Controller.StoreOrdersController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class StoreOrdersController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
StoreOrders controller to link the StoreOrders View to the StoreOrders Model. It updates the list view and total price upon selection and removal of an order. In addition, you can export ALL stored orders to a text file.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the order combobox to show all the added orders that have not been removed.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - url if provided.
      resourceBundle - resourceBundle if provided.

    • getOrders

      public static StoreOrders getOrders()
      Getter for the store orders object to add new orders.
      Returns:
      StoreOrders object that represents all the orders that are currently stored that have not been removed.

    • checkEmptyStoredOrders

      public boolean checkEmptyStoredOrders()
      Handles the checking if the stored orders has any orders. If no orders, generate a warning and disable the buttons.
      Returns:
      true if empty, otherwise false.

    • disableFields

      private void disableFields()
      Disables the combobox to select orders, the delete order button, and the export order button.

    • updateOrderDetails

      private void updateOrderDetails​(Order order)
      Updates the list view with the menu items stored in the order, the total price displayed.
      Parameters:
      order - the order to display in the list view and associated total price

    • handleSelectedOrder

      public void handleSelectedOrder()
      Handles the selection of an order in the order combobox. Upon selection, it will update the order displayed in the list view and associated total price. If there are no orders, it will generate an Alert warning the user that there are no orders stored and disable all buttons.

    • handleDeleteOrder

      public void handleDeleteOrder()
      Handles the deletion of the current selected order in the combobox. Upon deletion, it will display the order before it, and if there are no orders before it, it will display the next order. In addition, it will update the associated total price and the menu items of the order in the list view. If there are no orders after removing the current selected order, it will disable all buttons and display an alert to the user informing there are no more orders to display.

    • clearOrderDetails

      public void clearOrderDetails()
      Clears the displayed order list view and the total price.

    • handleExportOrder

      public void handleExportOrder()
      Handles the exporting of ALL non-removed orders. (The orders displayed in the combobox) Upon export, it will generate an alert informing the user if it succeeded or not. If it did not succeed, it will contain the reasoning in the content section. In addition, if orders are stored then it will not export but display the appropriate alert and disable all the buttons.

    • generateEmptyWarning

      private void generateEmptyWarning()
      Generates an Alert that indicates the user should place some orders because there are no more stored orders.
